name: Tokyo
description: Capital of Japan, blending tradition and modernity. Famous for Shibuya Crossing, Tokyo Tower, anime culture, and cutting-edge technology.

name: Kyoto
description: Ancient capital of Japan, known for its temples, shrines, and tea houses. A cultural treasure with geisha districts and seasonal festivals.

name: Osaka
description: Japan’s kitchen, famous for takoyaki and okonomiyaki. Known for Osaka Castle, Universal Studios Japan, and its vibrant nightlife.

name: Hiroshima
description: Historic city remembered for the Peace Memorial Park and Atomic Bomb Dome. Also known for Itsukushima Shrine and local okonomiyaki.

name: Sapporo
description: Capital of Hokkaido, popular for its Snow Festival, skiing, and beer. Famous for miso ramen and beautiful winter landscapes.

name: Nara
description: Japan’s first permanent capital, home to Todai-ji Temple and the Great Buddha. Famous for Nara Park where friendly deer roam freely.

name: Fukuoka
description: Major city on Kyushu Island, well-known for Hakata ramen and lively street food stalls. A hub for festivals and cultural exchange.

name: Yokohama
description: Port city near Tokyo with Japan’s largest Chinatown. Famous for Cup Noodles Museum, waterfront parks, and the Minato Mirai skyline.

name: Nagoya
description: Industrial hub and home of Toyota, with cultural landmarks like Nagoya Castle. Offers unique miso katsu cuisine and modern shopping areas.

name: Hakone
description: Famous hot spring resort town with views of Mount Fuji. Known for Lake Ashi cruises, Hakone Shrine, and scenic ropeways.

name: Kobe
description: A vibrant port city famous for Kobe beef, scenic harbor views, and the historic Kitano district. Offers Mount Rokko, Chinatown, and modern shopping.

name: Kanazawa
description: A cultural city known for Kenrokuen Garden, Kanazawa Castle, and traditional tea houses. Famous for gold leaf crafts and preserved samurai districts.

name: Nagasaki
description: A historic port city remembered for its unique blend of Japanese and European culture. Highlights include Glover Garden, Dejima, and the Atomic Bomb Museum.

name: Kamakura
description: A coastal city with historic temples and shrines, including the Great Buddha. Known for scenic hiking trails, beaches, and traditional shopping streets.

name: Takayama
description: A beautifully preserved Edo-period town in the Japanese Alps. Famous for its old town, Hida Folk Village, morning markets, and seasonal festivals.

name: Matsumoto
description: A castle town famous for Matsumoto Castle, historic streets, and modern art museums. Nearby Kamikochi offers stunning alpine nature and hiking.

name: Matsuyama
description: Known for Matsuyama Castle, Dogo Onsen, and historic temples. Offers retro charm with the Botchan Train and scenic coastal views.

name: Kumamoto
description: A castle city with Kumamoto Castle, Suizenji Garden, and Hosokawa Mansion. Offers family-friendly attractions like the zoo and botanical gardens.

name: Nikko
description: Famous for Toshogu Shrine, Shinkyo Bridge, Kegon Falls, and Lake Chuzenji. A scenic and spiritual destination with Edo-period cultural experiences.

name: Ise
description: Sacred city home to Ise Grand Shrine, Okage Yokocho, and Futami Wedded Rocks. Known for spiritual heritage, traditional shopping streets, and scenic coastal views.
